text: ljus is a shared service with three
partners we work with Cambridge in
Northamptonshire and Milton Keynes
councils but we also have some customers
in Northampton Borough Council and
Horsham District Council and Norwich
City we work with these councils to
provide a whole range of services but we
share them across all the different
authorities so they get the benefit of
expertise and reuse across our whole
shared services environment before a
diverse came along was was very much on
premise it was all geared around how we
make local networks work how we create
links between them and how we can can
use everything we've already got to the
best of its capability and there'd be
quite a slow refresh cycle so innovation
or any change really you couldn't call
it innovation happen quite slowly
whereas now that pace of change is
massively increased the available
services to us a phenomenal and it
allows us to do things that we we just
didn't think was possible before one of
the projects that we embarked on
initially was mostly around how we can
speed up the pace of change on
delivering our typical web applications
so just how do we get that scale you get
the typical use case scenarios of a snow
day and everyone wants to understand
different information for us it was
things like school admissions or road
closures and these kind of things that
happen on a localized basis that are
really critical to those those users we
have people understanding whether or not
they can go to school on a day is really
important but the kind of scale we need
a temporary level just wasn't possible
without without the kind of Public
Health facing opportunities at Amazon
Web Services gave us so we needed a
solution to that and that address came
on just just the right time from then on
we've just progressed with as many use
case opportunities as we can kumusta
really it's it gives us an extra spark
to think about things in a completely
different way well we're not limited by
the tools that sort of sits around us
we've got other people working all over
the world developing developing services
that we can just consume like like their
water on tap which is phenomenal one of
the advantages of working within the
public sector is
it's part of our goal to reduce the
duplication that's happening so across
our different partners and customers a
lot of the services is very very similar
which is a phenomenal use case for us to
be able to work with because actually it
means that we can develop things once or
implement things once and reuse them
across the different customers and
partners the real benefit of us being a
shared service and being able to consume
services from from hubs and Web Services
is that everyone gets the benefit of
that reuse and everyone gets the value
back into to the services they're
delivering and ultimately taxpayers out
there on the street are getting the
benefit of us reusing things and that's
only really possible through these
services
